questions.text: Increase in the shear rate will reduce blood viscosity due to

options.text: dispersion of red blood cell aggregates also known as moneyroll formations
red blood cells assume a streamlined elongated shape
both mechanisms contribute to the effect
none of them contribute, since blood viscosity is independent of shear rate
decreases the incidence of turbulent blood flow
decreases the viscosity of the blood
decreases the peripheral resistance
promotes the Bohr's effect
increases the peripheral resistance

questions.text: Which of the following statements are correct?

options.text: plasma protein concentration is the major factor determining the viscosity of blood
the Fahreus-Lindquist effect shows that viscosity decreases in small vessels
viscosity increases at high flow velocities
high viscosity decreases the tendency to turbulent flow
shear stress (shear force) on wall increases with viscosity
the viscosity of blood decreases if the velocity of flow increases
viscosity of blood increases if the blood flows in narrower blood vessels up to diameters of 7-10 micrometers
the viscosity of blood remains constant despite changes in the velocity of flow
the viscosity of blood increases if the velocity of flow increases
viscosity of blood decreases if the blood flows in narrower blood vessels up to diameters of 7-10 micrometers
the viscosity of blood decreases if the velocity of flow increases
viscosity of blood increases if the blood flows in narrower blood vessels up to diameters of 7-10 micrometers
viscosity of blood decreases if the blood flows in narrower blood vessels up to diameters of 7-10 micrometers
the viscosity of blood remains constant despite changes in the velocity of flow
the viscosity of blood increases if the velocity of flow increases

questions.text: The MOST important factor determining the shape of red blood cells in the circulation

options.text: the elasticity of the red blood cell's membrane
the cytoskeleton of the red blood cell
the activity of contractile proteins within the red blood cell
the passive deformations due to shear forces
